description: 12-workout sport performance program following NASM's OPT Model, progressing through Stabilization, Strength Endurance, and Power phases for athletic development
target_audience: Athletes and fitness enthusiasts seeking sport-specific performance improvements

phases_covered.focus: Building foundational stability, endurance, and movement quality
Maximizing power output and explosive performance

workouts.coaching_tips: Perform activation and resistance exercises in two mini circuits.

exercises.exercise_name: Foam Roll: Calves, Adductors, Tensor Fascia Latae, Lats
Static Stretch: Calves, Adductors, Tensor Fascia Latae, Lats
Dynamic Stretch: Leg Swings: Side to Side; Leg Swings: Front to Back; Tube Walking: Side to Side
Foam Roll: Calves, Adductors, Tensor Fascia Latae, Lats
Static Stretch: Calves, Adductors, Tensor Fascia Latae, Lats

program_notes.phase_1_notes: Focus on stability, control, and building proper movement patterns. Tempo should be slow (4-2-1). All plyometric movements should be held for 3-5 seconds upon landing.
program_notes.phase_2_notes: Combine strength and stabilization with supersets. First exercise in each superset is moderate tempo strength, second is slow tempo stabilization. Active stretching replaces static stretching.
program_notes.phase_5_notes: Maximum power development through explosive movements. Pair heavy strength exercises with explosive power exercises in supersets. Rest periods are longer (2 minutes) to allow for quality explosive efforts.

warm_up_progression.phase_1: Foam rolling + static stretching + dynamic stretching
warm_up_progression.phase_2: Foam rolling + active stretching + dynamic stretching
warm_up_progression.phase_5: Foam rolling + dynamic stretching (no static stretching)

implementation_for_massimino.usage: This 12-workout program can be assigned to athletes or integrated into sport-specific training plans
implementation_for_massimino.customization: Trainers can modify exercises within each category while maintaining the phase structure
implementation_for_massimino.progression: Athletes should complete workouts 1-4 before progressing to 5-8, then 9-12

duration_recommendations.advanced: Can repeat phases or cycle through multiple times
